citation.article-title: Sphingomonas japonica sp. nov., isolated from the marine crustacean Paralithodes camtschatica.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas japonica sp. nov.
Sphingomonas japonica (ja.po′ni.ca. N.L. fem. adj. japonica Japanese, pertaining to the Sea of Japan, the place from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile rods (0.6–0.8 μm wide and 1.5–1.8 μm long).
Colonies on R2A agar are 1–2 mm in diameter, yellow–orange pigmented, smooth, shiny and transparent, with regular edges.
No production of diffusible pigments is observed.
Growth temperature optimum is 25–28 °C; no growth occurs at 4 or 37 °C.
Sodium ions are not required for growth.
Oxidase and catalase are positive and β-galactosidase is weakly positive in API 20NE tests.
Positive for H2S production.
Indole, urease and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
Gelatin is hydrolysed slowly over 4–5 days in both routine and API 20NE tests.
Hydrolysis of Tween 80 is positive.
Casein, starch and chitin are not hydrolysed.
Acid is not produced from d-glucose, cellobiose, maltose, mannose, sucrose, trehalose, melibiose, lactose, d-xylose, mannitol or glycerol.
Other physiological and biochemical characteristics are given in Table 1.
API 20NE test results are negative for glucose acidification, arginine dihydrolase, urease and mannitol assimilation.

API ID 32GN test results are negative for assimilation of itaconic acid, suberic acid, sodium malonate, sodium acetate, lactic acid, propionic acid, capric acid, trisodium citrate, l-alanine, l-proline, 3-hydroxybutyric acid, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid, potassium 5-ketogluconate, glycogen, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, d-mannitol, l-fucose, d-sorbitol, l-rhamnose, inositol, l-arabinose, l-serine, valeric acid, l-histidine and potassium 2-ketogluconate.

API ZYM test results are positive for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and β-glucosidase, weakly positive for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8) and α-glucosidase and negative for lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Polar lipids include phosphatidylcholine, sphingoglycolipid, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and an unknown lipid.
Contains C18 : 1, C16 : 1 and C16 : 0 as major fatty acids and 2-OH C14 : 0 as the major 2-hydroxy fatty acid; minor fatty acid components are C14 : 0, C15 : 0, C17 : 1 and C19 : 1.
The type strain is KC7T (=KMM 3038T =NRIC 0738T =JCM 15438T), isolated from a specimen of the crab Paralithodes camtschatica collected from Peter the Great Bay, Sea of Japan, Russia.
